articles.author: Gabriella Borter, Joseph Ax, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Messages call for protesters to be deported or expelled, possibly raped or killed.
articles.title: Name and shame: Pro-Israel website ramps up attacks on pro-Palestinian student protesters

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The White House said on Friday it was watching the Israeli operations with concern.
articles.title: Israel orders people in more areas of Gaza's Rafah to evacuate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five people were killed and nine wounded in three separate Ukrainian drone and artillery strikes on the Russian border provinces of Belgorod and Kursk, and the city of Donetsk, which Russia claims to have annexed, local officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Five killed in Ukrainian strikes on Russian border regions, Donetsk, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines said on Saturday it has deployed ships to a disputed area in the South China Sea, where it accused China of building "an artificial island" in an escalating maritime row.
articles.title: Philippines sends ships to disputed atoll where China building 'artificial island'

articles.author: Sayed Hassib, Mohammad Yunus Yawar
articles.description: The official death toll from devastating flash floods in northern Afghanistan has risen to 153 people across three provinces, the Taliban's interior ministry said on Saturday, while the World Food Progamme said it was double that.
articles.title: Afghanistan floods kill at least 153, Taliban interior ministry says

articles.author: Jacob Gronholt-Pedersen
articles.description: Dutch contestant Joost Klein has been expelled from Saturday's Eurovision Song Contest final after a complaint by a member of the production crew, organisers said, adding to the headaches for host Sweden as it also grapples with anti-Israel protests.
articles.title: Joost Klein expelled as Eurovision braces for protests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An evacuation alert has been issued for Fort McMurray, Alberta, as an out-of-control fire rages southwest of the Canadian oil town, making it among the first actions ahead of the wildfire season.
articles.title: Wildfire evacuation notice issued for Alberta town Fort McMurray

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Colombia granted conditional release to former paramilitary leader Salvatore Mancuso, his defense team confirmed on Saturday.
articles.title: Colombia paramilitary leader Salvatore Mancuso released by Bogota court

articles.author: Camillus Eboh
articles.description: Prince Harry spoke in Nigeria on Saturday of the tragic loss of the "brave souls" in the country's military who had lost their lives in conflicts, and said he felt "goosebumps" after seeing plans for a new centre to rehabilitate injured troops.
articles.title: In Nigeria, Prince Harry speaks of 'brave souls' losing lives in conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eight more Chinese cities have joined a scheme allowing their residents to travel to Hong Kong on their own, rather than as part of a tour group, as part of efforts to boost Hong Kong's economy.
articles.title: Eight more Chinese cities join Hong Kong solo travel scheme
